I found this product several months ago while looking for ways to reduce the plastic coming into my home. I've been happy with it. It even has some fluoride, which my dentist likes. But this time, the cans came individually wrapped in plastic! Why? Seems completely unnecessary and defeats my reason for buying it. Very disappointing. I won't order it again.

Review Text: My mother used to buy this Colgate tooth powder back in the 50‚Äôs and 60‚Äôs. Remembering how clean the powder made my mouth feel I thought I‚Äôd give this powder a try. Nope not the same!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on 6 January 2023

Review Text: I don't know who approved this packaging but geezz, they could've done way better. It was a headache to open. I had to lift the cover and punch a hole through it to access the powder. Then the powder would get stuck so I removed the cover all together, now it still gets stuck so I squeeze the bottle to get it out and the powder starts flying all over the place lol.You can tell when people are just putting products just together to make a quick buck.The taste however, is super strong and fresh for sure. I'm tempted to add water to the bottle and just make it into a paste that I can squeeze out. AKA I'll just stick to regular toothpaste lol

The cap is plastic and very poor design.  Impossible to open because it is hard molded plastic covering the hole.  Was excited to find toothpaste in a can instead of the plastic tubes but this cap is a complete non-starter.  Come on Colgate- you should be embarrassed at this design!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 June 2022

Review Title: Not a tooth powder A box of harsh chemical powder
Review Text: In initial days of using it will tempt you by it's smell and cleaning property but on longer use it harms you adversely. Please don't use this tooth powder, it has SLS in dry form, a detergent which we commonly find in handwash, clothes detergent, floor cleaner, Car washing chemical, even in our everyday toothpaste. I am suggesting to those who want use 100% natural go for vicco,patanjali,nogi,khadi jagriti herbs,charak,k.p.namboodiri,dabur etc....Indians are blindly using it for decades attracted by it's tactic advertisements and looks.

Review Text: The last time that I purchased Colgate tooth powder was in the late 1960's.  Obviously, I don't use it very often.  When I saw it was still available, I purchased a new tin.  Yet it was nigh impossible to open.  Can was destroyed the second time that I tried to open it. A complete waste, I would give the product 5 stars and the packaging 0 stars.
